Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Yes if there are no difficulties with such implementation @dimxy

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: In cc assets most of the errors are discovered on the validation stage while the rpc creation code itself is rather simple. So usually a transaction could be created but if it has an issue it will be found later, while the tx is validated

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: adding a new method  to check the amount of unconfirmed tokens balance (similar to `tokenbalance` ) shouldn't be too complicated right ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you mean scanning the mempool?

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: I mean a method similar to `getunconfirmedbalance` , but for getting unconfirmed token balance, I don't know in details how `getunconfirmedbalance` is implemented though

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is possible, but very tricky as the addressindex is not updated with mempool

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: best would be to scan mempool for affected tokens and mark it as pending, but it will be much easier to wait until the confirmation and addressindex updates

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Hi, is a NFT just a UTXO?

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content:
yes, everything is utxo based, the difference between NFT utxo & a "normal" utxo is the scriptSig/scriptPubKey.
try using `decoderawtransaction` on the hex value returned by `tokentransfer` / `sendtoaddress` for example, you'll see the difference.
